is a temple town, 75 km from

Srivilliputtur is one of the old historical town that was ruled by Pandya kings initially. This town has a 1000 year old temple, 200 year old Hindu School, 135 year old Pennington Public Library that are standing as remarkable historical evidence for culturally importance of this place. Thiruppavai, one of the important constituent of devotional Tamil literature period was from this temple town. The remarkable landmark of Srivilliputhur is 11-tiered tower structure dedicated to the Lord of Srivilliputhur, known as Vatapatrasayee, an avatar of Lord Vishnu.

(~70 km). Madurai Airport is around 1.5 hours from Srivilliputtur.
are operating daily flights between Madurai Airport and

that reaches Srivilliputhur every day at 6.13 in the morning. Summer special trains are available from Virdhunagar Jn in summer (April–June). A daily passenger train service is also available from Madurai and Shenkottai. Peoples come from many cities to this Srivilliputtur station to visit many places especially Andal Temple. In the coming budget people are expecting new trains to Bangalore and Coimbatore. Currently people are using Virudhunagar to reach Coimbatore and Bangalore by Nagercoil-Coimbatore Express and Tutucorin-Mysore Express respectively
Buses to Srivilliputhur are there from Periyar(to Thirumangalam and from there we need to catch another bus to Srivilliputhur) and Mattuthavani(direct bus) bus stands of
.  Buses from both places pass through Srivilliputhur as it is on the way of Madurai - Rajapalayam - Tenkasi - Shenkottai highways. Buses to Srivilliputtur from

starting from the main bus stand are available every half an hour. Buses from main places in Tamil Nadu to Srivilliputhur are frequent.

content=Its well known as Gothandam pillai hotel in this area. Its from one of the partners from Kathiravan. Very tasty food and safe home made food. It is well known for Saambar. Every day morning and evening 4 different types of Saambar are served with Dosas and Idlis. If one is lucky, one can find traditional food like Kaeppai Dosai, Susiyam, Gothumai Dosai etc. Also services available for traditional functions. Sunday Spl mid day meals.
Palmyrah Juice, sold by Tamil Nadu Government Co-Operative Society, located near Srivilliputtur Bus Stand Entrance
Rose milk, flavored sweetened milk drink from Ananda Bakery
content=Its from one of the partners from Kathiravan.

The best time to visit this town is during the Margazhi Thirunal (December–January) and the Adi Thirunal (July–August) which are very popular and provide a rare experience of the traditional temple festivals, some of them unique to this town.
There are many Hotels and Lodges available to support the visitors.However some of the houses at the very street in which The Andal temple is situated,have been converted to Convenient boarding places.
